content.description: Start with right hand on side pull crimp and left hand in a gaston palm to top out. Climbing shoes not necessary
content.location: At the top south side of Nippert Stadium off of CCM Blvd. There are two curved brick structures here. This route is on the eastern curve facing the stadium further away from "Climb Crimps, Man" if you're walking from there.

content.description: Hug the corner and use the square metal plates as feet. One move to the left and top out. Do not use the white bit on the bottom left (see image).
content.location: By the white door next to "Touchdown"

content.description: Start with wide legs and climb up to the same topout as "Climb Crimps, Man". Do not use the south-facing wall/corner with feet or hands (see image).
content.location: Same as "Climb Crimps, Man", in the Northwest end of CCM circle by the wall that says "Robert J. Werner".

content.description: Mini slopers and side pulls to top out. Good texture. There is the eponymous rainbow orca on the opposite side of the wall that you top out on and a not-so-fun chossy chimney climb that's probably not worth it.
content.location: Bottom of the DAAP parking lot on the westernmost side. Walk or drive down Clifton Court, enter the garage, take the stairs all the way down, and walk left. Top of route is visible from the road. This route is about 1 minute walking due west from the UC Mountaineering Club store room.

content.description: Start with a right hand on the bomber corner and use either of the crimpy rails to shimmy feet up and top out. Quite fun for how short it is. Climbing shoes not necessary
content.location: In the courtyard just below New Chemistry in the Zimmer Roof Garden

content.description: Sit start underneath as low as possible on either side and traverse left or right to top out, be careful of the low risk but long fall on either side of the top out. The only boulder to use a metal structure on campus (the handrail for the top out), climbing shoes not necessary
content.location: By the triangular-prism skylight windows in the Zimmer Roof Garden, sort of nearby the front entrance of Baldwin and behind the Old Chemistry building

content.description: Start with a sidepull + microcrimp and slap to the arête. Use a gaston, sidepulls, and the arête to reach the light grey stripe and match on the rail. The light grey concrete to the left is off. The difficulty of the individual moves on this climb vary quite a lot so grading it was sort of a function of average.
content.protection: 1 pad is fine, two could be useful. Be prepared for a bit of a drop from the top
content.location: Just outside of the tunnel that goes under the Geology-Physics building, on a wall facing Clifton Ave. Right around the corner from CLOVER and 4 LEAVES.

climbs.name: In the Shadow of Crosley Tower

content.description: Hand foot match, smear, and tug your way through this unique mantle
content.location: Above the DAAP parking lot. Can be accessed by walking across the DAAP bridge and turning right into the little open area with a building-access concrete stairway that this problem can be found on

content.description: A little less than 30 feet of quarter pad crimps on the same size feet all the way up to the sloper jug rail. Dihedral is out. Not beta intensive by any means, but it takes a certain amount of focus at height. I strongly advise you be confident enough to climb this without relying on pads because they won't help you much unless you downclimb. You should be able to do laps on The Sound of Music before attempting this. I have not attempted the dihedral but I'm guessing that's about V1
content.protection: Two pads is fine for the bottom half, but you'd want more layered protection if you wanted to fall from any higher
content.location: Directly opposing the CCM Starbucks door, the top of this boulder is the ledge on the other side of the railing. Walk down the curved staircase from there and go around. You can alternatively approach this boulder by walking down the road about 2 minutes from Educator where it is across from a grassy knoll

content.description: Dihedral turns into a narrow chimney climb and top out. Start with low feet for a couple starting slab moves or jump and slap your foot right up into the windowsill. Fun and consistent route with a little flaking towards the middle to watch out for.
content.location: Off the right side of Clifton Court on the Western face of the Geology-Physics building, right around the corner from "Clover" and "Four Leaves"

content.description: Crimps and side pulls lead to a very fun deadpoint and topout. Very easy beginning, grade justifying(?) last move at height. One of the most dynamic and satisfying boulders around campus
content.location: The northernmost line of the outside of Corry Garage on Dennis Street. Near the baseball field.

content.description: Sit start at the bottom of the stairs, climb underneath, traverse the bridge, find feet + a tiny crimp on the wall, and dyno from there to top out. Use the fence for V1 (climbing shoes not necessary for V1 variant)
content.location: On the inside of the stairs next to the Southern entrance to CECH. Right off of McMicken Circle and Clifton Ave

content.description: This is a classic to campus. It's a consistent and diverse line that takes a bit of solving. There is a chalk drawing of a clover on the route and "CLOVER" written so I guessed that was the name. If you FA'd this boulder or have climbed it please comment!
content.location: On the Westernmost part of the tunnel under the Geology-Physics building just off Clifton Court

content.description: Quarter pad crimps to top out
content.location: Near the big brown artificial tree trunk in the Northwest of CCM circle. There is a big wall ornament that says "Robert J Werner Recital Hall" that makes this route pretty easy to find (see image).

content.description: Go up the letters. Top out provides a nice view but can be quite wet if it has rained recently. Easily doable barefoot, street shoes will be a challenge, pad recommended
content.location: Right off MLK Dr., across from DAAP, just outside of Burnet Woods

content.description: Start with both hands under the pool window to a shouldery gaston press, make your way under the overhang and come out the other side for a nice top out. DON'T use the large ledge underneath (see photo). One of my favorites.
content.location: Near CRC circle attached to the rec enter on Main Street. Close to the Engineering Research Center

content.description: Start standing as low as you can and monkey up the proudest boulder-esque face on campus and top out. Climbing shoes not necessary, pad recommended. A bit of a slug fest, can't make very many attempts on this in a session with how it treats your skin
content.location: In the middle of Main Street on campus attached to the rec center. Just up the hill from "Campus Recreation"

content.description: Start and end in a sit start and move from the outside of the East side of the semicircle to the opposing side using any holds and feet (no walking up the pillars, obviously). Kind of a dumb traverse, but it's just something to do if you're over by this polylith for the other climbs.
content.location: Right off MLK Dr., across from DAAP, just outside of Burnet Woods

content.description: Very similar route to "Rainbow Orca" but more accessible from the road + slightly worse holds and a slightly more challenging topout. Don't use the garage lettering
content.location: On the right side of the front face of Clifton Court Garage

content.description: Refrigerator climb to the top, don't use the pillars to the left and right. Top out provides a nice view but can be quite wet if it's rained recently. There is a structure at the bottom of this one that's impossible to protect, so be cautious because a shallow fall could be dangerous.
content.location: Right off MLK Dr., across from DAAP, just outside of Burnet Woods

content.description: Chimney climb to a corner crimp and pull hard till your feet touch. Traverse slab right and climb over.
content.protection: Probably don't need anything for this one but there is an opposing face you don't want to slam into if you slip on the slab part
content.location: In the front of the College of Law right off of Clifton Ave. To the left of the stairway kind of hidden behind some shrubbery

content.description: Directly to the right of Clover is this similar, but harder climb.  Named after the 4 side pulls used in the original beta.  The rock quality is just as good as it's sister climb and it leaves the hardest move for last!
content.location: On the Westernmost part of the tunnel under the Geology-Physics building just off Clifton Court.  Right of Clover

content.description: Climbs on campus! Most climbs here will be "buildering" as there are not any natural rock formations around UC. However, every boulder here is on something similar to rock like concrete or brick and many have walkoffable topouts. Please add to this page if you know of any good climbs.
